snippet: Many unpaid jobs in the fashion and magazine industries perpetuate inequality and may violate labor laws.
abstract: Ginia Bellafante Big City column expresses criticism of unpaid internships prevalent in New York City's fashion world; argues that it impedes efforts to reduce unemployment and assists in perpetuating inequality, privileging the already-fortunate who can afford work without pay.
lead_paragraph: Many unpaid jobs in the fashion and magazine industries perpetuate inequality and may violate labor laws.
